verses.verse: And when they were near to Jerusalem and came to Bethphage toward the Mountain of the Olives, at that time, Jesus sent two students out on a mission,
saying to them, "Travel into the village, the one up in front of you. And right away you will find a donkey that has been tied up and a foal with her. After you release them, lead them to Me.
And if anyone says something to you, you will state, 'The Master has need of them.' He will send them out right away."
This whole thing has happened so that what was stated through the preacher (in Zechariah 9:9) might be accomplished that says,
"Tell the daughter of Zion, look, your king comes to you submissive and having climbed up on a donkey and a foal, a son of a workhorse."
When the students traveled and did just as Jesus instructed them,
they led the donkey and the foal and placed their robes up on top of them, and they seated Him up on top of them.
The biggest crowd spread out their own robes in the road. Others were chopping branches off the trees and spreading them out in the road.

The crowds, the ones going ahead and the ones following, were yelling, saying, "Hosanna (Hebrew for 'O, rescue us') to the Son of David, the One coming in the Master's Name that has been conferred with prosperity. Hosanna in the highest things."
And when He came into Jerusalem, the entire city was shook, saying, "Who is this?"
The crowds were saying, "This is the preacher Jesus, the One from Nazareth, Galilee."

And Jesus went onto God's temple grounds and threw out all the people buying and selling on the temple grounds. And He turned over the tables of the currency exchangers and the benches of the people selling the doves.
And He says to them, "It has been written, (in Isaiah 56:7) 'My house will be called a house of prayer,' but you made it a cave of bandits."
And blind and crippled people came to Him on the temple grounds, and He healed them.

But when the head priests and the Old Testament transcribers saw the amazing things that He did and the boys yelling on the temple grounds and saying, "Hosanna to the Son of David," they were infuriated.

And they said to Him, "Do you hear what these are saying?" But Jesus says to them, "Yes, did you never even once read, (in Psalm 8:2) 'From the mouth of infants, even nursing infants, You developed praise?'"
And after He left them down there, He went outside of the city to Bethany, and spent the night there outside.
In the morning, as He was taking them up into the city, He was hungry.

And when He saw one fig tree up the road, He went up to it and found nothing in it except leaves only. And He says to it, "No fruit will ever come into existence from you for the span of time," and the fig tree shriveled up at once.
And when the students saw it, they were amazed, saying, "How did the fig tree shrivel up at once?"

When Jesus answered, He said to them, "Amen, I tell you, if you have trust and do not consider it to be wrong, not only will you do the thing of the fig tree, but even if you say to this mountain, 'Be picked up, and be thrown into the sea,' it will happen.
And everything, however many things that you will ask for in the prayer, trusting, you will receive."

And after He came onto the temple grounds, the head priests and the older men of the ethnic group came to Him as He was teaching, saying, "In what kind of authority do you do these things, and who gave you this authority?"
When Jesus answered, He said to them, "I will also ask you one saying that, if you tell me, I will also state to you in what kind of authority I do these things.

The submersion of John, where was it from, from heaven or from people?" The men were thoroughly considering it beside themselves, saying, "If we say from heaven, He will state to us, 'So why didn't you trust him?'
But if we say from people, we fear the crowd. You see, all hold John as a preacher."
And when they answered Jesus, they said, "We do not know." He also was declaring to them, "Neither do I tell you in what kind of authority I do these things.
What does it seem to you? A person had two children. And when he came to the first, he said, 'Child, go back today. Work in my vineyard.'
When the child answered, he said, 'I don't want to.' But later after he changed his mind, he went off.
And when he came to the second child, he said similarly. When the child answered, he said, 'I am going, master,' and he did not go off.

Which one from the two did what the father wanted?" They say, "The first." Jesus says to them, "Amen, I tell you that the tax collectors and the prostitutes are going ahead of you into the empire of God.

You see, to you came John on a road of the right way, and you did not trust him. But the tax collectors and the prostitutes trusted him. When you saw it, you did not later change your mind for the purpose to trust him.

Listen to another illustration. There was a certain person, a property owner, someone who planted a vineyard, put a barrier wall around it, dug a grape smashing pit in it, built a tower, leased it out to farmers, and left the area.
When the right time for the fruits was near, he sent his slaves out to the farmers to take its fruits.
And after the farmers took his slaves, there was one that they beat, another that they killed, another that they threw stones at.
Again he sent out other slaves, more than the first, and they did similarly to them.
Later he sent out his son to them, saying, 'They will be embarrassed around my son.'
But when the farmers saw the son, they said among themselves, 'This is the inheritor. Come on, we should kill him, and we will hold down his inheritance.'
And after they took him, they threw him outside of the vineyard and killed him.
So when the master of the vineyard comes, what will he do to those farmers?"
They say to Him, "Bad farmers, in a bad way he will ruin them and lease the vineyard out to other farmers, some who will give him back the fruits at their right times."

Jesus says to them, "Did you never even once read in the Old Testament writings, (in Psalm 118:22, 23) 'A stone that the people who are building, rejected, this became for a corner's head; this happened from the side of the Master, and it is amazing in our eyes'?
Because of this, I tell you that the empire of God will be taken away from you and given to a nation producing its fruits."
And the person who falls on this stone will be shattered, and whoever it falls on, it will grind him up.
And when the head priests and the Separatists heard His illustrations, they knew that He was talking about them.
And as they looked to take Him into custody, they feared the crowds since, for sure, they held Him as a preacher.
